snippet: A new stimulus package could help jump-start Japan’s moribund economy, but structural reforms are needed for long-term revival.
abstract: Editorial expresses support for $116 billion stimulus package unveiled by Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe; contends, while stimulus is step in right direction, it alone will not be enough for nation's long-term revival, and that structural reforms will be needed.
lead_paragraph: A new stimulus package could help jump-start Japan’s moribund economy, but structural reforms are needed for long-term revival.
